description: Demolition of existing garage and erection of two storey side extension, erection of a rear dormer extension, external alterations including new bay windows, fenestration changes and installation of roof lights.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.	Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development  hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.	Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Before the beneficial occupation of the development hereby permitted, the referenced windows shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part below that level shall be fitted with, and retained in, obscure glazing to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. The referenced windows are as follows:The first floor window fitted in the rear elevation  serving the room labelled as 'New Bedroom 3' on drawing number 220066PL26 Rev B Proposed First Floor Plan ; The second floor dormer window in the rear elevation serving the room labelled as 'New Study on drawing number 220066PL27 Rev C Proposed Loft Plan ; and The first floor window fitted in the side (east) elevation serving the room labelled as 'New bathroom' 220066PL26 Rev B Proposed First Floor Plan Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable and tamper-proof, and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3. Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers, in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development hereby approved shall be used for purposes ancillary to the main dwelling house, and shall not be used, sold or sub-let as a separate self-contained unit. Reason: A separate unit of accommodation of this nature is not acceptable in this location in the interests of the amenities, character of the area and highway safety in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The assessment of this application is based on measurements taken from the submitted drawings / plans. If it transpires that the drawings / plans submitted are incorrect this would nullify the validity of this decision and you are advised to submit a fresh application with the correct information / drawings.
No information regarding proposed materials for alterations to the front elevation were submitted, therefore not complying with condition A.3(a).

Some information was submitted regarding the proposed materials for the rear dormer, however it is unclear  if the face and sides of the dormer would match the existing roof as required by Condition B.2(a).

If you have evidence to contradict the local planning authority's assessment of the application, you are encouraged to apply for the development again and include that evidence in support of the application.
